alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:29AM EST until December 25 at 3:35PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour affecting Washington, Jackson and Lawrence Counties. White River at Petersburg affecting Pike, Daviess, Gibson and Knox Counties. White River at Hazleton affecting Knox and Gibson Counties. White River at Elliston affecting Greene, Daviess and Knox Counties. .Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches will cause minor flooding to develop along portions of the White River and the East Fork White River in southern parts of central Indiana. Flooding may persist into Christmas Eve for portions of the White River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Hazleton. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Floodwaters cover much low ground in agricultural season. Low lying oil fields...Pottsville Road and possibly a few other low rural roads flood. High water isolates Pottstown, a river cabin community. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river will rise to 15.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 15.2 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning. It will rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue to rise to 17.9 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall to 17.0 feet and begin rising again Wednesday morning. It will rise to 17.8 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1130 PM EST /1030 PM CST/.
